brief_description of the content in the: The source URL provides information about the outdated TestNG annotation @Configuration. It suggests that it is better to configure a test suite with the modern @BeforeXXX / @AfterXXX annotations and provides an example of how to apply this quick-fix.
generated_rule_explanation from GPT-4: The rule 'old-configuration-annotation-used' checks all classes in the project. If a class has the @Configuration annotation, it asserts that the class should not have this annotation. If the assertion fails, it generates a message indicating that the class uses the outdated @Configuration annotation and suggests using the modern @BeforeXXX / @AfterXXX annotations instead.
new_built-in_functions_explanation if an: The built-in functions used in this rule are: getClasses, hasAnnotation, getFQN. No new functions were introduced.
3rd-party most relevant URLs and summary:
1. URL: https://www.javatpoint.com/testng-annotations
Summary: This page provides a comprehensive guide to TestNG annotations, including the modern @BeforeXXX / @AfterXXX annotations. It does not specifically mention the outdated @Configuration annotation, but it provides a good reference for understanding the context of the rule.

2. URL: https://www.toolsqa.com/selenium-webdriver/testng-annotations/
Summary: This page also provides a detailed guide to TestNG annotations. It explains the purpose and usage of each annotation, which can help understand why the @Configuration annotation is outdated and why the @BeforeXXX / @AfterXXX annotations are recommended.
